title: VIDEO: It's John Lennon's 75th birthday – Can you 'Imagine' what's in our Top 10?
text:
Inspired by the Al Pacino film Danny Collins, we're going Cold Turkey to look at the work of the ultimate Working Class Hero. 
So simply sit back, Hold On and let us examine Whatever Gets You Through The Night. 

Danny Collins is actually the first time that a film has ever been able to use a full set of original John Lennon recordings. 
It is loosely inspired by the true story of a letter written by John Lennon and Yoko Ono to young folk musician Steve Tilston. 
Tilston never received the letter but screenwriter/director Dan Fogelman used the story as the inspiration for his script. 
During the writing process he then created scenes with Lennon originals accompanying them. 
The film is a fitting reminder of the life and music of one of the all-time greats. 
Although Lennon was shockingly torn away from us in 1980, his legacy lives on. 
And UK fans can recreate the famous bed-in protest photographs of Lennon and Ono at a new exhibition at the Beautiful Crime gallery in London. 

Our selection of John Lennon videos are the actual songs that soundtrack the film, Danny Collins. 
Danny Collins stars Al Pacino as the eponymous aging 1970s rocker, who can't give up his hard-living ways. 
When his manager (Christopher Plummer) uncovers a 40 year-old undelivered letter written to him by John Lennon, he embarks on a heartfelt journey to rediscover his family, find true love and begin a second act. 
Screen legend Annette Bening plays feisty hotel manager, Mary, with whom he develops an unconventional romance. 
Danny Collins is out now on DVD. Related articles
